intro: Toxocarpus auriculatus var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf toxocarpus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. The variety glabrescens is distinguished by its smooth, hairless leaves, which set it apart from other varieties of Toxocarpus.
